title: Bump actions/stale from 6 to 7
body:
Bumps [actions/stale](https://github.com/actions/stale) from 6 to 7.
Release notes

Sourced from actions/stale's releases.

v7.0.0

⚠️ This version contains breaking changes ⚠️

What's Changed

  • Allow daysBeforeStale options to be float by @​irega in actions/stale#841
  • Use cache in check-dist.yml by @​jongwooo in actions/stale#876
  • fix print outputs step in existing workflows by @​irega in actions/stale#859
  • Update issue and PR templates, add/delete workflow files by @​IvanZosimov in actions/stale#880
  • Update how stale handles exempt items by @​johnsudol in actions/stale#874

Breaking Changes

  • In this release we prevent this action from managing the stale label on items included in exempt-issue-labels and exempt-pr-labels
  • We decided that this is outside of the scope of this action, and to be left up to the maintainer

New Contributors

  • @​irega made their first contribution in actions/stale#841
  • @​jongwooo made their first contribution in actions/stale#876
  • @​IvanZosimov made their first contribution in actions/stale#880
  • @​johnsudol made their first contribution in actions/stale#874

Full Changelog: https://github.com/actions/stale/compare/v6...v7.0.0

v6.0.1

Update @​actions/core to 1.10.0 #839

Full Changelog: https://github.com/actions/stale/compare/v6.0.0...v6.0.1

Changelog

Sourced from actions/stale's changelog.

Changelog

[7.0.0]

:warning: Breaking change :warning:

  • Allow daysBeforeStale options to be float by @​irega in actions/stale#841
  • Use cache in check-dist.yml by @​jongwooo in actions/stale#876
  • fix print outputs step in existing workflows by @​irega in actions/stale#859
  • Update issue and PR templates, add/delete workflow files by @​IvanZosimov in actions/stale#880
  • Update how stale handles exempt items by @​johnsudol in actions/stale#874

[6.0.1]

Update @​actions/core to v1.10.0 (#839)

[6.0.0]

:warning: Breaking change :warning:

Issues/PRs default close-issue-reason is now not_planned(#789)

[5.1.0]

Don't process stale issues right after they're marked stale [Add close-issue-reason option]#764#772 Various dependabot/dependency updates

4.1.0 (2021-07-14)

Features

  • Ability to exempt draft PRs

4.0.0 (2021-07-14)

Features

  • options: simplify config by removing skip stale message options (#457) (6ec637d), closes #405 #455
  • output: print output parameters (#458) (3e6d35b)

Bug Fixes

  • dry-run: forbid mutations in dry-run (#500) (f1017f3), closes #499
  • logs: coloured logs (#465) (5fbbfba)
  • operations: fail fast the current batch to respect the operations limit (#474) (5f6f311), closes #466
  • label comparison: make label comparison case insensitive #517, closes #516
  • filtering comments by actor could have strange behavior: "stale" comments are now detected based on if the message is the stale message not who made the comment(#519), fixes #441, #509, #518

Breaking Changes

... (truncated)

Commits
  • 6f05e42 draft release for v7.0.0 (#888)
  • eed91cb Update how stale handles exempt items (#874)
  • 10dc265 Merge pull request #880 from akv-platform/update-stale-repo
  • 9c1eb3f Update .md files and allign build-test.yml with the current test.yml
  • bc357bd Update .github/workflows/release-new-action-version.yml
  • 690ede5 Update .github/ISSUE_TEMPLATE/bug_report.md
  • afbcabf Merge branch 'main' into update-stale-repo
  • e364411 Update name of codeql.yml file
  • 627cef3 fix print outputs step (#859)
  • 975308f Merge pull request #876 from jongwooo/chore/use-cache-in-check-dist
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

title: Cache tsbuildinfo files
body:
<!-- Thanks for sending a pull request! -->
<!-- Please add a useful description explaining what this PR does -->

This PR caches .tsbuildinfo files. They are found in a variety of ways:
- If incremental is turned on in comilerOptions, and nothing else is provided, it will default to `tsconfig.tsbuildinfo`
- If incremental is turned on and an outDir is specified, it will be `{OUTDIR}/tsconfig.tsbuildinfo`
- If incremental is turned on and a tsbuildnfo file is provided, it will cache that file.
- This also supports extending other tsconfigs.

Fixes #626

<!-- PR Checklist  -->
<!-- - [ ] Tests are added/updated if needed  -->
<!-- - [ ] Docs are updated if needed  -->

title: Fix Rust custom toolchain file support
body:
This PR fixes `rust-toolchain.toml` file support by
- Adding support to copy files into the build image before packages are installed with Nix
- Fix the rust-toolchain file path
- Add a docker run test for custom rust toolchain support

Fixes https://github.com/railwayapp/nixpacks/issues/686

title: noninteractive debian frontend and install tzdata
body:
This PR updates the base Ubuntu image to
- Set `DEBIAN_FRONTEND=noninteractive`
- Set `TZ=Etc/UTC`
- Install `tzdata` package from apt-get

title: Install openssl from nixpkgs if prisma is detected
body: This PR will install the `openssl` package from nix if prisma is detected in the node provider. This is necessary for the upcoming switch to Ubuntu where the openssl is version 3. Prisma seems to be having an issue finding the correct shared library files. Installing openssl from Nix directly fixes the issue and also uses the latest openssl version.

title: Default to Ubuntu base image
body:
This PR sets the default base image for all Nixpacks build to use Ubuntu. The old debian base image can be used by setting the variable `NIXPACKS_DEBIAN=1`.

As part of this change I've also updated the node provider to always install the openssl nix package

Fixes https://github.com/railwayapp/nixpacks/issues/649
Fixes #574

title: Create an Ubuntu base image
body:
Create an Ubuntu base image to test against.
There are a few reasons for wanting to switch from Debian to Ubuntu

- Better security updates. Most notably it has out of the box support for OpenSSL, which is now the default in Nixpkgs.
- The default for many other platforms such as GitHub actions, Heroku, and Paketo buildpacks
- Produces a 20MB smaller image

This PR does not change the default in Nixpacks. It just simply sets up publishing of an Ubuntu base image to a GitHub and Dockerhub registries

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3044853/207455726-b129a380-143e-4f40-92ca-519f89eb1808.png)

body: This PR fixes a typo in the java command for gradle / spring boot.

title: Remove 7.4 from PHP supported versions in docs
body:
The documentation states that PHP 7.4 is supported, which had us spending time trying to port a PHP 7.4 maintenance project to railway. This turned out to not be true:

Details by @coffee-cup 
https://github.com/railwayapp/nixpacks/issues/542#issuecomment-1331064901

This PR simply removes 7.4 as a supported version in the documentation.

title: Support copy files to a subdirectory in app directory
body:
<!-- Thanks for sending a pull request! -->
<!-- Please add a useful description explaining what this PR does -->

This PR gives a solution for issue #630. Now it's possible to use syntax like:

```toml
[start]
  onlyIncludeFiles = [
    '...',
    { from = './templates/index.html.hbs', to = './templates/index.html.hbs' }
  ]
```

so `index.html.hbs` is copied inside a `templates` subdirectory inside the app directory. That's an example that currently fails when using [Rocket](https://rocket.rs/).

I have an [example of a Rocket service](https://github.com/jhg/simple-parking) that doesn't work on Railway.app because templates' files are copied just in the app directory instead of the template folder.

<!-- PR Checklist  -->
- [X] Tests are added/updated
- [X] Docs are updated

body:

Release notes

Sourced from mislav/bump-homebrew-formula-action's releases.

bump-homebrew-formula 2.0

What's Changed

  • Use Node 16 by @​chenrui333 in mislav/bump-homebrew-formula-action#36
  • Bump minimist from 1.2.5 to 1.2.6 by @​dependabot in mislav/bump-homebrew-formula-action#33
  • Bump node-fetch from 2.6.6 to 2.6.7 by @​dependabot in mislav/bump-homebrew-formula-action#34

New Contributors

  • @​chenrui333 made their first contribution in mislav/bump-homebrew-formula-action#36

bump-homebrew-formula 1.16

  • Replaces broken v1.15 tag, thanks @​hendrikmaus mislav/bump-homebrew-formula-action#32
  • Add push-to option, thanks @​codefromthecrypt mislav/bump-homebrew-formula-action#30
  • Fix syntax error, thanks @​hendrikmaus @​wata727 mislav/bump-homebrew-formula-action#27
  • Ensure repeated placeholders in commit-message are expanded, thanks @​hendrikmaus mislav/bump-homebrew-formula-action#29

bump-homebrew-formula 1.14

  • Ignore HTTP 409 error when fast-forwading the main branch of homebrew-tap fork

bump-homebrew-formula 1.13

  • Add create-pullrequest input to control whether or not a PR is submitted to homebrew-tap
  • Add download-sha256 input to define the SHA256 checksum of the archive at download-url
  • Fix creating a new branch in the forked repo failing with HTTP 404

bump-homebrew-formula 1.12

  • Fix Actions CJS loader halting on foo?.bar JS syntax

bump-homebrew-formula 1.11

  • New optional formula-path input accepts the filename of the formula file to edit (default Formula/<formula-name>.rb).
  • Remove revision N lines when bumping Homebrew formulae.

bump-homebrew-formula 1.10

  • The new optional tag-name input allows this action to be manually triggered via workflow_dispatch instead of on git push to a tag.

bump-homebrew-formula 1.9

  • Fix following multiple HTTP redirects while calculating checksum for download-url

bump-homebrew-formula 1.8

  • Enable JavaScript source maps for better failure debugging

bump-homebrew-formula 1.7

  • Allow download-url as input parameter

  • Add support for git-based download-url

bump-homebrew-formula 1.6

  • Control the git commit message template being used for updating the formula file via the commit-message action input

bump-homebrew-formula 1.5

  • Support detection version from https://github.com/OWNER/REPO/releases/download/TAG/FILE download URLs

... (truncated)

title: significantly reduce ruby memory usage by setting default env variable MALLOC_ARENA_MAX=2
body:
Setting `MALLOC_ARENA_MAX=2` is basically an essential for ruby apps to not have crazy memory usage. [Heroku buildpacks set it by default](https://github.com/heroku/heroku-buildpack-ruby/pull/752).

We saw people migrating from Heroku to use nixpacks were having way worse memory usage.

title: Better output if there are no phases in the build plan
body:
This PR shows a better error message if there are no phases in the generated build plan


![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3044853/200046491-75bccafb-45c7-4c7d-9681-632bb6728ce4.png)

title: remove rvm source after install
body:
This PR decreases the final Ruby image size by a significant amount by removing the rvm source after installation

Fixes: https://github.com/railwayapp/nixpacks/issues/653

title: Lowercase provider names
body: This PR lower cases all the provider names

title: Detect command
body: This PR adds an experimental `detect` command that simply returns the list of providers that will be used to build the application. It is intended to be used on Railway, but the exact requirements are still TBD, which is why it is experimental. Use at your own risk as this may change in the future.

title: use nix pkgs instead of apt for rust musl-tools and binutils
body: This PR switches to using Nix instead of Apt for all Rust provider packages (`binutils`, and `musl-tools`)

title: allow passing a full build plan as command line argument
body:
This PR allows passing a full build plan as a command line argument. This is useful for systems that are running Nixpacks for a user and want to abstract away some of the configuration. The invididual args (e.g. `--build-cmd`, `--start-cmd`, `--pkgs`, etc.) can still be used and will override the values in the `--json-plan`.

By allowing an entire plan to be passed, A new CLI argument does not need to be added for every possible config option. And since everything is configurable via a build plan, the entire build can be customized via the CLI without the user needing to create a `nixpacks.toml` file in their code.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3044853/199347474-10d533a4-9ca3-4db1-a7e4-e08d9215d99a.png)

title: Update textwrap dep
body:
This PR updates textwrap to the latest version

https://crates.io/crates/textwrap

title: Bump base image to `debian-1667261211`
body: Automated changes by [create-pull-request](https://github.com/peter-evans/create-pull-request) GitHub action

title: Consistent Ruby Caching
body:
This PR fixes addresses a few things related to Ruby and Docker layer caching
- Install Ruby in a single Docker layer
- Noop dockerfile generation for a phase if it doesn't do anything
- Use `BTree(Map/Set)` to get determinstic sorting of phases when topological sorting phases

A fresh build of the [bullet_train](https://github.com/bullet-train-co/bullet_train) repo

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3044853/199097650-8a212bff-e0f0-408b-a199-abafd2fd44c2.png)

The commands for the next build are executed in the same order and take advantage of the docker layer cache (0.0s on installing ruby)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3044853/199097753-c6fa6f7a-d8f7-40ba-b2dd-462099c24e44.png)

Fixes https://github.com/railwayapp/nixpacks/issues/641

title: for ruby, cache bundle install by default if Gemfile* has not changed
body: I'm not aware of any cases where `bundle install` uses any files except for Gemfile and Gemfile.lock

title: Experimental Support for Multiple Providers
body:
This PR adds experimental support for generating a build plan that uses multiple providers. The providers must explicitly be set in the `nixpacks.toml` file. Extending the auto detected provider is supported with the `"..."` syntax.

### Phase names

The phases from the first provider in the list will keep the same names that they were created with. Subsequent providers phases will be prefixed with the name of the provider (e.g. `rust:setup`). This is done since phase names cannot have collisions as well as to correctly sort the phase build order. The rust build phase does not depend on the node install phase, and prefixing the phase names ensures that dependency isn't created.

One downside of this approach is that to override the behaviour of a specific non-first phase, you have to do something like
```toml
[phases."rust:build"]
cmds = ["..."]
```

which is a bit awkward. This is only because of allowed characters in the toml language. If the config format is Json, then it is a bit cleaner.

Suggestions of another prefix character besides `:` is welcome.

### Examples

This plan will use **only** the node and rust providers

```toml
providers = ["node", "rust"]
```

This plan will use the auto detected provider and python

```toml
providers = ["...", "python"]
```

### Why is this experimental

While testing this, I've noticed that many of the providers do not handle when specific language files (e.g. package.json) are not found when creating the build plan. Install, build, and start phases should only be added to the plan when appropriate. Some providers assume that since it is running, then there will always be an install, build, or start phases. These kinks will be discovered through use of multiple providers in different app scenarios. When using multiple providers, there is a warning that there might be some bugs.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3044853/198502969-dc7bc208-55df-4775-bc19-8ae8f5a6ae8f.png)

title: Remove tag action for now
body: Removes the auto-tag action as it is broken with a cryptic error and is messing up releases.

title: Basic support for .nvmrc files

Fixes https://github.com/railwayapp/nixpacks/issues/625

title: Prefer web procfile process
body:

title: support any package.json workspaces value
body: The `workspaces` key in `package.json` is typically an array of workspaces. However, it can be any object. Nixpacks should not crash if an array is not found. This PR handles that case gracefully.

This PR

title: add support to install a specific nixpacks version with NIXPACKS_VERSION
body:
There's been a few times that blindly installing the latest nixpacks version has broken deployments for our users so we need to be able to pin the version. Additionally I want to be able to easily install different nixpacks versions locally for testing.

This PR adds ability to specify the nixpacks version installed by `install.sh` by setting the `NIXPACKS_VERSION` env variable. It defaults to the latest version.


### Default

```
~/c/f/nixpacks> ./install.sh

? Install nixpacks 0.10.2 to /usr/local/bin? [y/N] y
> Installing nixpacks, please wait…

      +--------------+
     /|             /|
    / |            / |
   *--+-----------*  |
   |  |           |  |                Nixpacks is now installed
   |  |           |  |             Run `nixpacks help` for commands
   |  |           |  |
   |  +-----------+--+
   | /            | /
   |/             |/
   *--------------*

~/c/f/nixpacks> nixpacks -V
nixpacks 0.10.2
```

### Specific version

```
~/c/f/nixpacks> env NIXPACKS_VERSION=0.9.5 ./install.sh

? Install nixpacks 0.9.5 to /usr/local/bin? [y/N] y
> Installing nixpacks, please wait…

      +--------------+
     /|             /|
    / |            / |
   *--+-----------*  |
   |  |           |  |                Nixpacks is now installed
   |  |           |  |             Run `nixpacks help` for commands
   |  |           |  |
   |  +-----------+--+
   | /            | /
   |/             |/
   *--------------*

~/c/f/nixpacks> nixpacks -V
nixpacks 0.9.5
```

title: feat: add support for COBOL
body:
# Add support for COBOL

Ive added a basic COBOL provider and am looking for some feedback as its very minimal RN.

## Some things for discussion:

- Would support for https://cobolget.com/ be good?, or ironically that might fall under the remit of the nodeProvider as COBOLGet is a CLI published to `npm` for COBOL. ( although its installation guide does not suggest to install COBOLGet locally with a `package.json`, so maybe its not a node provider thing ).
- I believe each COBOL is a separate thing ( you cant import COBOLS into other COBOLS ). Ive done a bit of looking and have seen some people concatenate many COBOLS into one output binary. We should support this right? [example](https://github.com/azac/cobol-on-wheelchair/blob/master/downhill.sh). Behind a flag or automatically if we find multiple COBOLS.

Ive reached out to a COBOL community asking for their standard workflows, still awaiting a response, but the community is not that active so i don't hold much hope. And we have @MarkMeridius writes COBOL at work.

Gonna do some more Github trawling of COBOL codebases to find more use-cases this weekend / week.

- [x] Tests are added/updated if needed 
- [x] Docs are updated if needed

title: Softer NX requirements
body:
Fixes https://github.com/railwayapp/nixpacks/issues/566

Currently, if we detect a `nx.json` file in the root of the Node app we will treat the app as a Nx workspace and error if other the app is not setup in a perfect Nx way. This is a problem for legacy Nx apps that use the depreated `workspace.json` as we assume the location of apps are in the `apps/` directory. The treatment as an Nx app can also have other issues if the user just wants to opt-out of the automatic Nx features and manually specify the build/start commands.

So in this PR, I've
- Removed a few of the unwraps and bails
- Only detect as Nx app if an Nx app name and project directory can be found (fallback to regular node if not)
- Moved the Nx logic to the `nx.rs` file and trait impl

title: Default path to current dir
body: This PR defaults the `path` to the current directory, which will allow commands like `nixpacks plan` and `nixpacks build` with no additional arguments.

Fix issue when days-before-close is more than days-before-stale

fixes a bug introduced in #717

fixed in #775

v5.1.0

[5.1.0]

Don't process stale issues right after they're marked stale Add close-issue-reason option #764#772 Various dependabot/dependency updates

Changelog

Sourced from actions/stale's changelog.

Changelog

[6.0.0]

:warning: Breaking change :warning:

Issues/PRs default close-issue-reason is now not_planned(#789)

[5.1.0]

Don't process stale issues right after they're marked stale [Add close-issue-reason option]#764#772 Various dependabot/dependency updates

4.1.0 (2021-07-14)

Features

  • Ability to exempt draft PRs

4.0.0 (2021-07-14)

Features

  • options: simplify config by removing skip stale message options (#457) (6ec637d), closes #405 #455
  • output: print output parameters (#458) (3e6d35b)

Bug Fixes

  • dry-run: forbid mutations in dry-run (#500) (f1017f3), closes #499
  • logs: coloured logs (#465) (5fbbfba)
  • operations: fail fast the current batch to respect the operations limit (#474) (5f6f311), closes #466
  • label comparison: make label comparison case insensitive #517, closes #516
  • filtering comments by actor could have strange behavior: "stale" comments are now detected based on if the message is the stale message not who made the comment(#519), fixes #441, #509, #518

Breaking Changes

  • The options skip-stale-issue-message and skip-stale-pr-message were removed. Instead, setting the options stale-issue-message and stale-pr-message will be enough to let the stale workflow add a comment. If the options are unset, a comment will not be added which was the equivalent of setting skip-stale-issue-message to true.
  • The operations-per-run option will be more effective. After migrating, you could face a failed-fast process workflow if you let the default value (30) or set it to a small number. In that case, you will see a warning at the end of the logs (if enabled) indicating that the workflow was stopped sooner to avoid consuming too much API calls. In most cases, you can just increase this limit to make sure to process everything in a single run.
Commits
  • 3de2653 Update changelog for v6.0.0 (#829)
  • 02e44c8 fix(options)!: Make not_planned the default close-issue-reason (#807)
  • See full diff in compare view

You can also trigger a rebase manually by commenting `@dependabot rebase`. [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-start) [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-end) ---
Dependabot commands and options
You can trigger Dependabot actions by commenting on this PR: - `@dependabot rebase` will rebase this PR - `@dependabot recreate` will recreate this PR, overwriting any edits that have been made to it - `@dependabot merge` will merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot squash and merge` will squash and merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot cancel merge` will cancel a previously requested merge and block automerging - `@dependabot reopen` will reopen this PR if it is closed - `@dependabot close` will close this PR and stop Dependabot recreating it. You can achieve the same result by closing it manually - `@dependabot ignore this major version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this major version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this minor version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this minor version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this dependency` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this dependency (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself)

title: Test and fix prisma libssl error
body:
This PR
- Adds a docker run test for Prisma interacting and migrating a Postgres DB
- Fixes the libssl prisma error by pinning the nixpkgs archive to an older version
